title: Authors and Citation
text: Stephen Turner. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Turner S (2024). Tmisc: Turner Miscellaneous. R package version 1.0.1, https://stephenturner.github.io/Tmisc/, https://github.com/stephenturner/Tmisc.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Tmisc: Turner Miscellaneous},   author = {Stephen Turner},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://stephenturner.github.io/Tmisc/},   url = {https://github.com/stephenturner/Tmisc}, }

title: Turner Miscellaneous
text: Miscellaneous utility functions manipulating data R environment. Install CRAN: Install GitHub (potentially unstable): Documentation: https://stephenturner.github.io/Tmisc/

title: Mode — Mode
text: Returns mode vector. First tie wins (see examples).

title: Mode — Mode
text: x vector. na.rm Remove missing values calculating mode (FALSE default). NAs counted just like element. , NA vector necessarily result return NA. See first example.

title: Mode — Mode
text: mode input vector.

title: Histograms with overlays — Thist
text: Plot histogram either normal distribution density curve overlay.

title: Histograms with overlays — Thist
text: x numeric vector. overlay Either "normal" (default) "density" indicating whether normal distribution density curve plotted top histogram. col Color histogram bars. ... arguments passed hist().

title: Histograms with overlays — Thist
code: set.seed(42) x <- rnorm(1000, mean=5, sd=2) Thist(x)  Thist(x, overlay="density")  Thist(x^2)  Thist(x^2, overlay="density", breaks=50, col="lightblue2")

title: Tmisc: Turner Miscellaneous — Tmisc-package
text: Miscellaneous utility functions data manipulation, data tidying, working gene expression data biological sequence data.

title: Tmisc: Turner Miscellaneous — Tmisc-package
text: Maintainer: Stephen Turner vustephen@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Better scatterplot matrices — Tpairs
text: matrix scatter plots rugged histograms, correlations, significance stars. Much functionality borrowed PerformanceAnalytics::chart.Correlation().

title: Better scatterplot matrices — Tpairs
text: x numeric matrix data.frame. histogram Overlay histogram diagonals? gap distance subplots, margin lines. ... arguments passed methods.

what: Insert text at current position. — addins
title: Insert text at current position. — addins
text: Call function addin insert desired text cursor position. installing Tmisc, hit Addins menu, optionally add keyboard shortcut, e.g., Command+Shift+, Alt+-, etc.

title: Are all equal? — are_all_equal
text: elements numeric vector (approximately) equal?

title: Are all equal? — are_all_equal
text: x numeric vector. na.rm Remove missing values (FALSE default; NAs x return NA).

title: Are all equal? — are_all_equal
text: Logical, whether elements numeric vector equal.

title: Are all equal? — are_all_equal
code: are_all_equal(c(5,5,5)) #> [1] TRUE are_all_equal(c(5,5,5,6)) #> [1] FALSE are_all_equal(c(5,5,5,NA,6)) #> [1] NA are_all_equal(c(5,5,5,NA,6), na.rm=TRUE) #> [1] FALSE 5==5.000000001 #> [1] FALSE identical(5, 5.000000001) #> [1] FALSE are_all_equal(c(5L, 5, 5.000000001)) #> [1] TRUE

what: Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
title: Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
text: Prints first n rows columns data frame matrix.

title: Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
text: x data.frame. n number rows/columns print.

title: Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
text: corner data frame

title: Print the top left corner of a data frame — corner
code: corner(mtcars) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 corner(iris, n=4) #>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width #> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 #> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2 #> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 #> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2

title: Emulate ggplot2 default hues — gghues
text: emulate ggplot2's hues, equally spaced hues around color wheel, starting 15.

title: Emulate ggplot2 default hues — gghues
text: n Numeric; number hues generate. start Numeric; place color wheel start. ggplot2 default 15.

title: Emulate ggplot2 default hues — gghues
text: vector hues

title: Emulate ggplot2 default hues — gghues
code: n <- 10 gghues(3) #> [1] "#F8766D" "#00BA38" "#619CFF" barplot(rep(1,n), col=gghues(n), names=gghues(n))  barplot(rep(1,n), col=gghues(n, start=15+180), names=gghues(n, start=15+180))

title: x like y — %like%
text: Returns logical vector elements x matching regex y.

title: x like y — %like%
text: x vector (numeric, character, factor) pattern vector (numeric, character, factor), matching mode x

title: x like y — %like%
text: logical vector length equal x things x like y.

title: x like y — %like%
code: (Name <- c("Mary","George","Martha")) #> [1] "Mary"   "George" "Martha" Name %in% c("Mary") #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE Name %like% "^Mar" #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE Name %nin% c("George") #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE Name %nlike% "^Mar" #> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE

title: x not in y — %nin%
text: Returns logical vector elements x y.

title: x not in y — %nin%
text: x vector (numeric, character, factor) table vector (numeric, character, factor), matching mode x

title: x not in y — %nin%
text: logical vector length equal x things x y.

title: x not in y — %nin%
code: 1:10 %nin% seq(from=2, to=10, by=2) #>  [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE c("a", "b", "c") %nin% c("a", "b") #> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE

what: Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
title: Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
text: Get two-letter genotype VCF GT field. Current implementation quick dirty, accepts 0/0, 0/1, 1/1. input gt return missing value.

title: Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
text: gt genotype field (must 0/0, 0/1, 1/1). ref reference allele. alt alternate allele.

title: Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
text: Returnvalue

title: Two-letter genotype from VCF GT — gt2refalt
code: gt2refalt(gt="0/0", ref="R", alt="A") #> [1] "RR" gt2refalt(gt="0/1", ref="R", alt="A") #> [1] "RA" gt2refalt(gt="1/1", ref="R", alt="A") #> [1] "AA" gt2refalt(gt="0/2", ref="R", alt="A") #> [1] NA gt2refalt(gt="./.", ref="R", alt="A") #> [1] NA

title: Jensen-Shannon divergence — jsd
text: Calculates distance matrix matrix probability distributions using Jensen-Shannon divergence. Adapted https://enterotype.embl.de/.

title: Jensen-Shannon divergence — jsd
text: M probability distribution matrix, e.g., normalized transcript compatibility counts. pseudocount small number avoid division zero errors. normalizeCounts logical, whether attempt normalize dividing column sums. Set TRUE , e.g., count matrix.

title: Jensen-Shannon divergence — jsd
text: Jensen-Shannon divergence-based distance matrix.

title: Jensen-Shannon divergence — jsd
text: https://web.archive.org/web/20240131141033/https://enterotype.embl.de/enterotypes.html#dm.

title: Jensen-Shannon divergence — jsd
code: set.seed(42) M <- matrix(rpois(100, lambda=100), ncol=5) colnames(M) <- paste0("sample", 1:5) rownames(M) <- paste0("gene", 1:20) Mnorm <- apply(M, 2, function(x) x/sum(x)) Mjsd <- jsd(Mnorm) # equivalently Mjsd <- jsd(M, normalizeCounts=TRUE) Mjsd #>            sample1    sample2    sample3    sample4 #> sample2 0.04351841                                  #> sample3 0.06114582 0.04682573                       #> sample4 0.05485535 0.04587213 0.04641441            #> sample5 0.04869326 0.04697849 0.03939286 0.04894781 plot(hclust(Mjsd))

title: Lowest nonzero values — lowestnonzero
text: Sometimes want plot p-values (e.g., volcano plot MA-plot), statistical test returns zero p-value, causes problems visualization log scale. function returns vector  zero values equal smallest nonzero value vector.

title: Lowest nonzero values — lowestnonzero
text: x vector p-values 0 1.

title: Lowest nonzero values — lowestnonzero
text: vector p-values zero values exchanged lowest non-zero p-value original vector.

title: Improved list of objects — lsa
text: Improved list objects.  Sorts size default. Adapted https://stackoverflow.com/q/1358003/654296.

title: Improved list of objects — lsa
code: lsa(   pos = 1,   pattern,   order.by = "Size",   decreasing = TRUE,   head = FALSE,   n = 10 )

title: Improved list of objects — lsa
text: pos numeric. Position stack. pattern Regex filter objects . order.character. Either 'Type', 'Size', 'PrettySize', 'Rows', 'Columns'. dictate output ordered. decreasing logical. output displayed decreasing order? head logical. Use head output? n numeric. Number objects display head TRUE.

title: Improved list of objects — lsa
text: data.frame type, size bytes, human-readable size, rows, columns every object environment.

title: Improved list of objects — lsa
code: a <- rnorm(100000) b <- matrix(1, 1000, 100) lsa() #> Error in is.na(obj.dim)[, 1]: subscript out of bounds

text: character vector first n lines file.

title: Peek at the top of a text file — peek
code: if (FALSE) { filename <- tempfile() x <- matrix(round(rnorm(10^4), 2), 1000, 10) colnames(x) <- letters[1:10] write.table(x, file = filename, row.names = FALSE, quote = FALSE) peek(filename) }

Sort characters in a string — strSort
text: x string sort.

title: Sort characters in a string — strSort
text: sorted string.

title: Sort characters in a string — strSort
code: strSort("cba") #> [1] "abc" strSort("zyxcCbB105.a") #> [1] ".015BCabcxyz" strSort(c("cba", "zyx")) #> [1] "abc" "xyz" strSort(c("cba", NA)) #> [1] "abc" NA

title: Tmisc 1.1.0
text: Removed magrittr pipe (%>%) favor base R pipe (|>), requiring R 4.2.0 minimum. Remove deprecated functions. Update documentation throughout. functions now return tibble rather raw data.frame.

title: Tmisc 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-22 Remove functions deprecated >2 years ago. Fix package level documentation.

title: Tmisc 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-16 Bugfixes R devel checks. Move orphan functions utils. Deprecated many long superseded functions. Deprecated longer useful gene expression functions. New PDF template.

title: Tmisc 0.1.22
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-05 Bugfixes R 4.0.0 compatibility.

title: Tmisc 0.1.20
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-25 Deprecated several functions favor tidyverse alternatives. Modified PDF template.

title: Tmisc 0.1.19
text: CRAN release: 2018-03-20 primarily cleanup release. Several functions included Tmisc package early packages janitor development. release removes (note, removes, doesn’t deprecate) functions previously copied packages, introducing potentially breaking changes. Removed set_names() exported rlang. Removed beep(). Use beepr package instead. Removed remove_empty_cols(), remove_empty_rows(), convert_to_NA() clean_names(). Use remove_empty(), etc., janitor package instead. Removed unrowname(). Use magrittr::set_rownames() (loaded tidyverse).

title: Tmisc 0.1.18
text: Added RMarkdown template.

title: Tmisc 0.1.17
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-01 Add insert =. Optionally map keyboard shortcut Alt+- insert = instead traditional <-.

title: Tmisc 0.1.16
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-23 New functions %like% %nlike% work like %% %nin%, second argument regular expression match. New function gt2refalt() creates two-letter genotype GT field VCF file. Installs RStudio add-insert %%. brackets() dollar() is_in() () () equals() is_gt() is_geq() is_lt() is_leq() () set_colnames() set_rownames() set_names() set_attributes() set_attr()

title: Tmisc 0.1.15
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-16 New function mat2df() creates pairwise distance data frame square matrix.

title: Tmisc 0.1.14
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-08 keep_top_n() thanks Jeroen Janssens. deseqresult2tbl() now lets name column extracted DESeq result’s rownames anything want. Added Datasaurus Dozen. Small updates enable documentation pkgdown. Inconsequential update %nin%.

title: Tmisc 0.1.13
text: CRAN release: 2017-03-15 Cs() (Hmisc): Convenience function create quoted character vector unquoted strings.

title: Tmisc 0.1.12
text: CRAN release: 2017-01-22 Minor bugfixes

title: Tmisc 0.1.11
text: convert_to_NA() converts string values true NA values (adapted sfirke/janitor) clean_names() cleans names data frame. Resulting names unique consist _ character, lowercase letters, numbers (taken sfirke/janitor). remove_empty_rows() remove_empty_cols() removes rows columns composed entirely NA values (taken sfirke/janitor).

title: Tmisc 0.1.10
text: CRAN release: 2016-09-14 Tpairs() displays better pairwise scatterplot matrices pairs(). Thist() plots histogram either normal distribution density plot overlay. corner() displays first rows columns data frame matrix. beep() plays short beep alert something’s done (beepr package).

title: Tmisc 0.1.9
text: CRAN release: 2016-09-01 Minor bugfixes.

title: Tmisc 0.1.8
text: CRAN release: 2016-07-22 jsd() compute Jensen-Shannon divergence matrix probabilities. Mode() returns mode vector. gg_na() produces plot showing missing values data frame. are_all_equal() assess whether components numeric vector (approximately) equal.

title: Tmisc 0.1.7
text: CRAN release: 2016-06-15 gghues() generates color palette emulating ggplot2’s default hues.

title: Tmisc 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2016-06-06 fisherp() uses Fisher’s method combine p-values.

title: Tmisc 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2016-02-03 dokuwiki() convert data.frame dokuwiki-formatted table, copy said table system clipboard ’re Mac OS X.

title: Tmisc 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2016-01-25 strSort() alphabetically sorts characters string.
